0: UPDATE 12:45 a.m. (CBS13) — The suspect in a shooting that sparked an hours-long standoff with police and federal law enforcement agencies has been taken into custody alive. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Reports suggest Samuel Nathan Duran, 32, had injuries to his hand and face. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A robot was sent in at around 11 p.m. on Friday to try to make contact with the suspect. Just before 12:30 a.m. on Saturday, the robot had made partial contact with the suspect. After a brief discussion with authorities, the suspect emerged from the home. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ROSEVILLE (CBS13) — A standoff continued into Friday night in Roseville after a suspect allegedly shot a special agent with the Department of Homeland Security investigations. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR In total, four officers were wounded on Friday. Three are still being treated at Sutter Roseville Medical Center, but a Roseville Police officer has been released after being treated for shrapnel to the face. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The suspect, Samuel Nathan Duran, 32, is a parolee from Roseville, and is currently holed up in a home. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The original shooting happened on Hampton Drive near Riverside Avenue at around 3:30 p.m. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR CBS13 cameras caught a woman and her small child managing to escape a nearby home that was supposedly broken into by Duran. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The woman, her husband and their child were in the home when they say they heard Duran trying to get in. They rushed to a back bedroom where the husband laid on their little girl to protect her while holding the door shut. When they heard gunshots, they decided to flee to safety. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Roseville Police Chief Daniel Hahn visited the hospital on Friday to check on his three injured officers. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “Obviously a tremendous amount of concern for our fallen officers that were shot, and the ICE officer that was shot,” he said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR “As you can imagine, they came to work today to do their job and protect the city of Roseville, and a very violent person injured them,” Hahn said. “We’re just hoping they recover quickly.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Family and friends of Duran pleaded throughout the night for him to give himself up and bring the standoff to a peaceful close. So far, that has not happened. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Related articles hours-long of a their the NEWLINE_CHAR and NEWLINE_CHAR 12:45 Roseville (CBS13) NEWLINE_CHAR alive. home small
